alert.note: Alert for Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 3:56PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Park County through 430 PM MDT... At 355 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Clark, which is also 14 miles northwest of Powell, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elk Basin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin
